Attacks.name: meleeweapon
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a melee weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>.

Attacks.name: meleeweaponbonus
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a melee weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon will be used in addition to any other attacks the monster has.

Attacks.name: meleeweaponspec
Attacks.description: Equips the monsters with a special melee weapon. Any normal melee attacks after this one will not be used if this attack was used. Normally used for lances.

Attacks.name: meleeweaponlong
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a melee weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. The weapon is long and can be used to attack from the second row.

Attacks.name: meleeweapon50s
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a melee+skip attack that has 50% chance of being used. If it is used the next attack will be skipped.

Attacks.name: rangedweapon
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a ranged weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>.

Attacks.name: rangedweaponbonus
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a ranged weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon will be used in addition to any other attacks the monster has.

Attacks.name: rangedweapon25
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a ranged weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon has a 25% chance of being used in melee combat.

Attacks.name: rangedweapon50
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a ranged weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon has a 50% chance of being used in melee combat.

Attacks.name: rangedweapon50s
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a range+skip weapon that has 50% chance of being used in melee (100% at range). When used the next weapon will be skipped.

Attacks.name: rangedweapon50x
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a range+skip weapon that has 50% chance of being used in melee or range. When used the next weapon will be skipped.

Attacks.name: siegeweapon
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a siege weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon will be used in locations that allow sieges like cities and castles. Siege weapons are used in the first ten rounds of combat before any normal attacks are made.

Attacks.name: assassinweapon
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with an assassination weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon will be used to make an assassination attempt on an enemy before normal combat (including siege weapons) begins. Assassination attempts can only be used by the attacker and cannot be used against summoned creatures the summoner fails to control.

Attacks.name: prebatweapon
Attacks.description: Equips the monster with a prebattle effect weapon of this name that has a base damage of <dmg>. This weapon will be used before any normal combat (including assassination) begins.

Basic.name: name
Basic.description: This command renames an existing monster. It is not needed when creating a new monster.

Basic.name: spr1
Basic.description: The file name of the normal image for the monster. This command sets the attack sprite to this image as well.The image should be 32x32 or 64x64 for normal sized monsters and 128x128 for huge monsters. A human being should be about 34 pixels tall and there should be 2 pixels of free space between his feet and the bottom of the image.

Basic.name: spr2
Basic.description: The file name of the attack image for the monster. If this is not set then spr1 will be used for this image too. This command must come after the spr1 command.

Basic.name: descr
Basic.description: Description of the monster. The ^ character will be replaced with a newline.

Basic.name: hp
Basic.description: The maximum number of hit points for the monster. A normal human soldier has 6 hit points and an elite heavily armored soldier has 10 hit points. An ogre has 25 hit points a troll has 56 hit points and giants dragons and other huge monsters can have well over a 100 hit points.

Basic.name: mr
Basic.description: The magic resistance of the monster. Animals have a magic resistance of 2 a normal human has 4 and a more susceptible human has 3. Apprentice mages have a magic resistance of 6 full mages have 8 and master mages have 9. Some highly magical beings may have even higher magic resistance and they can almost never be affected by magic that is resistible.

Basic.name: str
Basic.description: The strength of the monster. A normal human soldier has a strength of 4 an elite human soldier has 5 a troll has 8 or 9 and giants and dragons have 10 to 12.

Basic.name: armor
Basic.description: This command sets the monster’s armor value which represents its natural protection or the armor it is wearing. Normal human troops have an armor value of 0. Medium armored human troops have an armor value of 1. Heavily armored human troops like Heavy Infantry have an armor value of 2 and very heavily armored troops like Knights and High Lords have an armor value of 3. Extremely tough monsters like dragons may have an armor value of 4 or more.

Basic.name: mor
Basic.description: The morale of the monster. A normal human soldier has a morale of 4 an elite human soldier has 5 or 6 and powerful monsters can have a morale of 8 or more. Very fearless monsters may have a morale of 15. Setting the morale to 99 makes the monster Mindless and it will be completely unaffected by fear or any other effects that influence morale.

Basic.name: rank
Basic.description: Sets the default deployment rank for the monster. -1 = back 0 = mid 1 = front

Behaviour.name: horror
Behaviour.description: Likes to kill sentient people also isn’t scared of the void.

Behaviour.name: nonruin1
Behaviour.description: Loves stuff that can be turned into ruins but is not yet a ruin.

Behaviour.name: stray
Behaviour.description: Can stray away from loved and liked terrains.

Behaviour.name: stupid
Behaviour.description: Cannot be controlled by players and will move automatically like an independent unit.

Behaviour.name: semistupid
Behaviour.description: Will move automatically like an independent units unless it is controlled by a player commander.

Behaviour.name: followstupid
Behaviour.description: Doesn’t move independently but follows other stupid units.

Behaviour.name: coastal
Behaviour.description: Loves the coast like a giant crab.

Behaviour.name: lone
Behaviour.description: Moves independently of the player and not in groups.

Behaviour.name: wander
Behaviour.description: Will try to fulfill an objective if it is a commander. See table Objectives for possible values.

Behaviour.name: indwander
Behaviour.description: Only wander if owned by Independents

Behaviour.name: infwander
Behaviour.description: Only wander if owned by Inferno

Behaviour.name: celwander
Behaviour.description: Only wander if owned by Celestials

Behaviour.name: hadeswander
Behaviour.description: Only wander if owned by Hades

Behaviour.name: wander2
Behaviour.description: Try to fulfill this objective if the first one was not possible

Behaviour.name: infwander2
Behaviour.description: Try to fulfill this objective if the first one was not possible

Behaviour.name: celwander2
Behaviour.description: Try to fulfill this objective if the first one was not possible

Behaviour.name: hadeswander2
Behaviour.description: Try to fulfill this objective if the first one was not possible

Behaviour.name: maxsinners
Behaviour.description: Will gather sinners when owned by Inferno (value=amount before returning)

Behaviour.name: maptele
Behaviour.description: Can teleport on world map when it is a wandering monster.

Behaviour.name: wanderrest
Behaviour.description: A chance for wandering monsters to rest a turn instead of going on a mission. Dragons have about 85 in this ability.

Behaviour.name: wandermaxdist
Behaviour.description: Maximum distance for raid missions for wanderers. Dragons have about 6 in this ability.

Behaviour.name: pickupanimals
Behaviour.description: Picks up all animals in the same square and brings them along.

Behaviour.name: wanderattack
Behaviour.description: Pause wander to attack this faction if adjacent (-1=all factions -2=player factions)

Behaviour.name: winteridle
Behaviour.description: Monster will not move in the winter if it is in a cold part of the map.

Copy/Clear.name: copyspr
Copy/Clear.description: Copy the sprite of another monster.

Copy/Clear.name: clearspec
Copy/Clear.description: Removes all special abilities from the active monster. The special abilities are things like Fire Immunity Regeneration etc. This command does not clear movement abilities. Use the clearmove command for that.

Copy/Clear.name: clearmove
Copy/Clear.description: Removes all movement attributes from the active monster.

Copy/Clear.name: clearweapons
Copy/Clear.description: Removes all weapons from the active monster.

Healing.name: coldheal
Healing.description: heals value hp/month when it’s cold

Healing.name: saner
Healing.description: regains this amount of sanity per month

Healing.name: minorstartaff
Healing.description: Chance of starting with a minor affliction. Chances >100 can give more than one affliction.

Movement.name: huge
Movement.description: Monster is giant sized. This also makes it a 3x3 square monster on the battlefield.

Movement.name: immobile
Movement.description: Monster is immobile (cannot move in battle).

Movement.name: stationary
Movement.description: Monster is stationary (cannot move on world map).

Movement.name: slow
Movement.description: Monster is slow on world map.

Movement.name: battlefast
Movement.description: Monster is fast but in battles only.

Movement.name: wateronly
Movement.description: Same as water & noland. The monster will be aquatic.

Movement.name: teleport
Movement.description: Like flying but the monster will teleport around in combat.

Movement.name: tunnel
Movement.description: Monster can tunnel on the world map.

Planes.name: reformdestroy
Planes.description: chance to destroy location on immortality respawn

Planes.name: homeplane
Planes.description: will return to this plane if slain outside it and be indep controlled again

Planes.name: noplanecamo
Planes.description: does not use fx_lookslike when in plane = value

Planes.name: hadesres
Planes.description: resistance to the effects of hades

Ritual.name: power
Ritual.description: pow nbr 0 means the last created ritual school -1 = the one before that etc. Positive numbers are existing ritual powers from CoE5 see the pow nbr table.

Ritual.name: classcost
Ritual.description: to alter cost of all rituals made by this unit 50=50% more expensive

Ritual.name: mastery
Ritual.description: for monsters that can level up nbr 1=become next monster on leveling -1=previous monster etc.

Ritual.name: allrit
Ritual.description: knows all rituals of this school (see the Ritual Schools table -1=all ritual schools)

Ritual.name: rebate
Ritual.description: gives rebate on rituals with fx_rebatefx??

Ritual.name: gatherherbs
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather herbs.

Ritual.name: gatherfungus
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather fungus.

Ritual.name: gathersacr
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather sacrifices.

Ritual.name: gatherhands
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather Hands of Glory.

Ritual.name: gatherweed
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather weed.

Ritual.name: gathergems
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather gems of individual types.

Ritual.name: gatheranygems
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather gems.

Ritual.name: seegems
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to see what type of gems mine produce.

Ritual.name: gatherrelics
Ritual.description: A commander with this ability will enable the player to gather relics.

Ritual.name: ctrlchance
Ritual.description: Chance of controlling this monster when it is summoned

Ritual.name: montag
Ritual.description: Sets the monster tag value referenced by other modding commands.

Shape Changing.name: growtime
Shape Changing.description: will grow into next monster after about value turns

Shape Changing.name: growoffs
Shape Changing.description: to become other than next monster

Shape Changing.name: landshape
Shape Changing.description: will take shape +value when on land

Shape Changing.name: watershape
Shape Changing.description: will take shape +value when in the sea

Spawning.name: motherspawn
Spawning.description: Spawns as one of a few special spawners in the game. 1 = mother of monsters 2 = teotls of war (spawns d2 jaguars or 1 ozelotls not on homeplane) 3 = teotls of rain (spawns d3 toad warriors not on homeplane) 4 = bloody mother (spawns d2 jaguars or d3 serpents not on homeplane) 5 = teotls of night (spawns d3 bats or 1 ozelotls not on homeplane) 6 = teotls of underworld (spawns 2d3 longdead not on homeplane) 7 = teotls of sky (spawns d3 bats or d3 eagle warriors not on homeplane)

Spawning.name: spawnmon
Spawning.description: Spawns next monster. value/100 = monsters per turn

Spawning.name: spawnoffs
Spawning.description: To spawn something other than the next monster

Spawning.name: spawnmonaway
Spawning.description: Spawns next monster but not on homeplane. value/100 = monsters per turn

Spawning.name: spawn1d6mon
Spawning.description: Spawns 1d6 of the next monster. value = chance

Spawning.name: spawn2d6mon
Spawning.description: Spawns 2d6 of the next monster. value = chance

Spawning.name: split
Spawning.description: Value = dmg required in % for splitting into next monster (like a slime).

Spawning.name: reform
Spawning.description: Value = chance in percent of reforming to prev monster each month (like a slime).

Spawning.name: satyrspawn
Spawning.description: Bonus for dryad queen auto spawns.

Spawning.name: harpyspawn
Spawning.description: Bonus for dryad queen auto spawns.

Spawning.name: centspawn
Spawning.description: Bonus for dryad queen auto spawns.

Spawning.name: minospawn
Spawning.description: Bonus for dryad queen auto spawns.

Spells.name: spellweapon
Spells.description: Equips the monster with a Cast Spell weapon in the magic path specified. This spell weapon only has a 25% chance of being successfully used in melee combat.

Spells.name: spellweaponbonus
Spells.description: Equips the monster with a bonus Cast Spellweapon in the magic path specified. This spell weapon can be used in melee without penalty.

Spells.name: spellweapon50
Spells.description: Equips the monster with a limited Cast Spell Weapon in the magic path specified. This spell weapon has only a 50% chance of being used on any given combat round.

Spells.name: spellweapon50s
Spells.description: Equips the monster with a limited Cast Spell+skip weapon in the magic path specified. This spell weapon has only a 50% chance of being used on any given combat round. If it is used the next weapon will be skipped.

Spells.name: spellweaponsingle
Spells.description: Equips the monster with a limited Cast Spell Weapon in the magic path specified. Only one of the single spell weapons will be used per combat round if the monster has several

Spells.name: more1spells
Spells.description: The monster starts with more or fewer level 1 spells when it spawns.

Spells.name: more2spells
Spells.description: The monster starts with more or fewer level 2 spells when it spawns.

Spells.name: more3spells
Spells.description: The monster starts with more or fewer level 3 spells when it spawns.

Start.name: selectmonster
Start.description: Selects the monster that will be affected by the following modding commands. The selected monster is referred to as the active monster. The selectmonster command always selects the first monster of that name in the monster list. If there is more than one monster with the same name (e.g. longdead) the offset value can be used to select them. Leave the offset out if you only want to select the first monster. The default value of the offset is 0. The offset used by this command cannot be set to a negative value unlike the offset for the lookslike command. Offset value 1 means the command selects the (first + 1) monster of that name i.e. the second monster. Offset 2 selects the third monster of the same name etc.

Start.name: newmonster
Start.description: Creates a new monster. This new monster will be affected by the following modding commands until the next active monster is set. The monster can have the same name as another monster.

Stealth.name: hideanimals
Stealth.description: animals following this commander gains forest stealth

Terrain.name: terraformfrom
Terrain.description: Changes this terrain into something. Use next two commands to setup that and how often.

Terrain.name: makecolony
Terrain.description: Has a chance of turning a standard terrain into ‘terr’ and then die.

Terrain.name: colonymsg
Terrain.description: 1 = everyone will get a message when a colony is created.

Type.name: setcreator
Type.description: used by monsters that get their name from their creator

Type.name: statue
Type.description: statues get part of their name from their creator e.g. Statue of Anselm

Type.name: expendable
Type.description: Is an expendable unit (can be used payment for certain rituals/recruitments).

Type.name: kobold
Type.description: Is an expendable kobold (counts as expendable unit but comes with a different ability description).

Type.name: goblin
Type.description: Is an expendable goblin (can be used payment for certain rituals/recruitments).

Type.name: madcultist
Type.description: Mad cultist might decide to open a gate to Inferno.

Type.name: primalcult
Type.description: Primal cultists might decide to open the primal gate.

Type.name: fungus
Type.description: 1 = is a fungus 2 = is an animated fungus.
